Description détaillée
Event Emitter Interface.
Anything that accepts listeners and emits events should implement this interface.
Copyright
Copyright (C) fruux GmbH (https://fruux.com/)
Auteur
Evert Pot (http://evertpot.com/) @license http://sabre.io/license/ Modified BSD License
Documentation des fonctions membres
emit() emitEmitterInterface EmitterInterfaceemit
emit (string $eventName, array $arguments = [] , callable $continueCallBack = null )
Emits an event.
This method will return true if 0 or more listeners were successfully handled. false is returned if one of the events broke the event chain.
If the continueCallBack is specified, this callback will be called every time before the next event handler is called.
If the continueCallback returns false, event propagation stops. This allows you to use the eventEmitter as a means for listeners to implement functionality in your application, and break the event loop as soon as some condition is fulfilled.
Note that returning false from an event subscriber breaks propagation and returns false, but if the continue-callback stops propagation, this is still considered a 'successful' operation and returns true.
Lastly, if there are 5 event handlers for an event. The continueCallback will be called at most 4 times. Voici le graphe des appelants de cette fonction :
listeners() listenersEmitterInterface EmitterInterfacelisteners
listeners (string $eventName)
Returns the list of listeners for an event.
The list is returned as an array, and the list of events are sorted by their priority.
Renvoie
callable[]
on() onEmitterInterface EmitterInterfaceon
on (string $eventName, callable $callBack, int $priority = 100 )
Subscribe to an event. Voici le graphe des appelants de cette fonction :
once() onceEmitterInterface EmitterInterfaceonce
once (string $eventName, callable $callBack, int $priority = 100 )
Subscribe to an event exactly once.
removeAllListeners() removeAllListenersEmitterInterface EmitterInterfaceremoveAllListeners
removeAllListeners (string $eventName = null )
Removes all listeners.
If the eventName argument is specified, all listeners for that event are removed. If it is not specified, every listener for every event is removed.
removeListener() removeListenerEmitterInterface EmitterInterfaceremoveListener
removeListener (string $eventName, callable $listener)
Removes a specific listener from an event.
If the listener could not be found, this method will return false. If it was removed it will return true.
La documentation de cette interface a été générée à partir du fichier suivant : public/glpi/vendor/sabre/event/lib/EmitterInterface.php
